content.title: Cyanoacrylate Vein Closure (VenaSeal)
content.description: Non-thermal, non-tumescent endovenous ablation using medical-grade cyanoacrylate adhesive to occlude incompetent saphenous veins.
content.mechanism: Cyanoacrylate polymerizes on contact with blood, mechanically sealing vein. Inflammatory reaction leads to fibrosis.

advantages.immediate: Immediate ambulation, no compression stockings required

disadvantages.cost: Higher device cost than thermal ablation

clinical_data.VeClose_trial: 97.2% closure at 3 years, non-inferior to RFA
